articles.title: US deploys Marines to Los Angeles as Trump backs arrest of California governor
articles.description: The US military will temporarily deploy about 700 Marines to Los Angeles until more National Guard troops can arrive, marking another escalation in President Donald Trump's response to street protests over his aggressive immigration policies.

articles.title: Groundbreaking crystal oxide transistors are faster, smaller and more reliable than silicon
articles.description: New crystal oxide transistor outperforms silicon, offering faster, smaller, and more reliable tech for AI and data-driven devices.
articles.content: Shrinking computers, faster phones, and smarter gadgets all rely on one tiny component: the transistor. Invented in the 20th century, it’s what powers nearly every modern electronic device. Transistors act like switches, turning electrical signals on... [6267 chars]

articles.title: Shots - Health News
articles.description: Health Secretary RFK Jr. has removed all 17 members of the CDC's Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices. He says replacing them with new members will help restore 'public trust' in vaccines.

articles.title: 'Opposite of Postecoglou' - what could Spurs expect from 'chef' Frank?
articles.description: Would Thomas Frank, who has likened managing in the Premier League to being head chef in a high-end restaurant, serve up success at Tottenham?

articles.title: Leaders of ‘Orgasmic Meditation’ Group Are Convicted of Coercion Charges
articles.description: Nicole Daedone and Rachel Cherwitz were charged with engaging in a forced labor conspiracy related to the sexual wellness company OneTaste.
articles.content:
Two women whose company promoted “orgasmic meditation” as a tool of female empowerment were found guilty on Monday of running a forced labor scheme in which they coerced vulnerable employees to perform degrading sex acts for little or no pay.

articles.title: Union leader faces federal charge of conspiracy to impede an officer
articles.description: SEIU California President David Huerta was released on a $50,000 bond. He can’t knowingly be within 100 yards of federal agents or operations.

articles.title: Proposed new whale-watching distances concern SA tourism operators
articles.description: Whale tourism operator Rod Keogh fears his business of 17 years may not survive the introduction of new whale nursery areas in SA.
articles.content:
The owner of a whale-tourism business says the proposed creation of new whale nursery protection areas could bankrupt his Eyre Peninsula company.
